page.title: 02EXMOUTH POST OFFICE.
page.content: Some of our class visited the Postmaster at the Exmouth post office. We found that: There are 60 post boxes in the Exmouth area. Only 1 in the last 23 years has been badly vandalised. The Exmouth post office delivers artificial limbs to the department of health. Some of the strangest things sent are tyres, ironing boards, step ladders and even a bird cage. The biggest change in the last few years has been mechanisation. The sacks that postmen use, used to be made by H.M prisons. Now they are made by big manufacturers. The price of the British stamp is expected to remain the same until 1986. The normal postage price is 17p(first class) or 13p(second class). If posted early, a first class letter reaches its destination the following day. Second class takes 3 days.
